LincolnInTheBardo: This is a challenging read, not that inherently satisfying until you get well into it and adapt to the author's unusual writing style
I think it is brilliant and thought-provoking but I also almost gave up in the first third of the book
I now understand why it was awarded the Man Booker prize
Be ready for weighty themes about life and death, war and destruction, and an in-depth look at and be ready to feel the profound grief of a parent at losing a child (Lincoln)
Don't read it before bedtime, it's too sad!
